body.p: Which of the following statements is correct?

multiple_choice.choice: In the left graph, the smallest population (in number of cells) corresponds to cells that are expressing neither CD5 nor CD19.
In the left graph, B cells (those CD19 positive) have as high CD5 expression as the T cells (CD19 negative).
In the right graph, B cells are CD5 negative.
In the right graph, the majority of cells are both CD19 and CD5 positive.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The population in the left lower corner (CD19 negative CD5 negative) has the largest number of cells (judged by the size of the cloud).
: Incorrect. The CD19+ cells (B cells) have a variable expression of CD5, but it is lower than those of T cells (CD19 negative).
Incorrect. The B cells of the BCLL patient are highly CD5 positive.
Correct. The BCLL patient has a large number of CD5 positive CD19 positive B cells, which is typical of leukemic cells (population labeled with the arrow).
